sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A confutation of monstrous and horrible heresies, taught by H.N. and embraced of a number, who call themselues the Familie of Loue by I. Knewstub. Seene and allowed, according to the Queenes Maiesties iniunctions. Knewstubs, John, 1544-1624.
[16], 94, [28] leaves
At the Three Cranes in the Vinetree, by Thomas Dawson, for Richard Sergier, Imprinted in London : 1579.
A reply to "Evangelium regni" and "Exhortatio" by Hendrik Niclaes. "A sermon preached at Paules Crosse the Fryday before Easter .. 1576" by Knewstub, P1-S4. H.N. = Hendrik Niclaes. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======
A confutation of monstrous and horrible heresies, taught by H.N. and embraced of a number, who call themselues the Familie of Loue by I. Knewstub. Seene and allowed, according to the Queenes Maiesties iniunctions. Knewstubs, John, 1544-1624.
[16], 94, [28] leaves
At the Three Cranes in the Vinetree, by Thomas Dawson, for Richard Sergier, Imprinted in London : 1579.
A reply to "Evangelium regni" and "Exhortatio" by Hendrik Niclaes. "A sermon preached at Paules Crosse the Fryday before Easter .. 1576" by Knewstub, P1-S4. H.N. = Hendrik Niclaes. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Richard Sergier
Thomas Dawson
the Three Cranes in the Vinetree
